intro: Steyermarkochloa unifolia, commonly known as the single-leaved grass, is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and compact growth habit, typically forming dense clumps. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
